question: According to recent Crowdtap and Forbes surveys, people said which of the following most influenced consumers’ purchase decisions?
answers: Family and friends

question: Which of the following are the 4 C’s of Social?
answers: Content, Connecting, Community & Curating

question: In Judy Franks’ interview, she discusses Five Global Truths That Make Sense of a Messy Media World. Which of the following is a truth she noted?
answers: Circuits: Media circuits are now open and in the hands of engaged consumers.

question: Which of the following is a reason why marketers are having so much trouble adapting to a new media ecosystem?
answers: Media platforms need to be liberated from silos.

question: Which of the following is a megatrend needed to develop social marketing strategies that grow market share and maximize results and profits for our organization? Check all that apply. (This question has multiple answers)
answers: Think real-time
Develop your professional networks
Develop a holistic view of social

question: What is the difference between social networks at the top of the social pyramid and virtual communities at the bottom of it?
answers: Social networks have shallow, quick conversations on a topic, whereas virtual communities have deeper and more long-term discussions of a topic.

question: Which of the following principles will help you succeed in managing change in social? Check all that apply. (This question has multiple answers)
answers: Classify sites by their function.
Focus only on sites containing your high-value markets.
Only add sites when they are popular to your target audiences.

question: Why are thought leaders important for your organization?
answers: They are influencers who have significant numbers of followers, and one positive mention from them will impact the people you want to attract.

question: Which of the following are characteristics of social networks? Check all that apply. (This question has multiple answers)
answers: Social networks are created to link members together as families, friends or colleagues to allow for conversation and the exchange of pictures.
The creators of social networks are entrepreneurs who want to eventually monetize their site.
Many social networks start by focusing on communication. Then, after they grow, they add some type of revenue generation device like advertisements to raise revenues.

question: Which of the following statements is true about virtual communities? Check all that apply. (This question has multiple answers)
answers: Virtual community members want to address their needs to express their passions or address a life event.
Most virtual communities are created by members who also manage them.
Conversations are deep and focused on subjects of interest to the members.

question: In a community, what is the role of the influencer?
answers: Influencers connect community experts with community members to spread key information throughout the community.

question: Which of the following are true of passion communities?
answers: Passion communities address an internal need of ours, and we seek them because we want to.

question: As an organization, what is important when we want to engage a trigger event community?
answers: These communities are on a mission and want to hear from experts who have the solutions they need.

question: As an organization, what is important when we want to engage a passion community? Check all that apply. (This question has multiple answers)
answers: We need to encourage peer-to-peer discussions to let members talk to each other about trends and important topics.
Passion communities are always seeking the newest trends, so we will need to keep up to remain relevant to our members.

question: Did you sign up for the social networking sites like Twitter, LinkedIn, or whatever is appropriate for your country?
answers: for the social networking sites like Tw

question: Did you sign up for social tracking sites like is.gd, or whatever is appropriate for your country?
answers: for the social networking sites like Tw

question: In social Big Data a “document” refers to:
answers: any single entry or posting on any type of social media.

question: A paragraph within a blog article would be considered a/an:
answers: snippet

question: APIs (automatic programming interface) are used for what purpose?
answers: To extract social data in real-time from a social site.

question: When thinking about your professional persona, which of the following recommendations should you consider? (This question has multiple answers)
answers: What happens on the internet, stays on the internet.
Somebody is always trying to figure out who you are, what you do and what your future might hold.
If something is free, you are the product.

question: Which of the following text analytics terms is used to describe how people on social “feel” about a topic?
answers: Sentiment

question: Which of the following is a common mistake companies make when trying social monitoring systems?
answers: Companies assume communities are referring to them by name.

question: Regardless of the market you want to monitor, discussions on social are typically about which of the following: (This question has multiple answers)
answers: Key people in these organizations.
Products and services.
Topics of interest to the community.
Organizations, including your company and your competition.

question: Social monitoring is used for which of the following? (This question has multiple answers)
answers: Developing social strategies
Real-time marketing
Crisis management
Developing personal brands

question: The “Give to Get” mantra involves which types of actions?
answers: Sharing tweets, blogs, and other media of your influencers with a positive tone.

question: How does Taco Bell deal with their more “passionate fans” on social media?
answers: They create a relationship with them and announce their latest products to these followers first.

question: When using social monitoring to manage crisis, at which point has the issue been detected too late?
answers: When it appears on the news or in print

question: Which of the following would be the best application for engagement marketing?
answers: Commodity or impulse products or products with a short selling process.

question: Which of the following is social strategies used by organizations focuses on growing social audiences and attracting people to social assets?
answers: Engagement Marketing

question: What is the success of Engagement Marketing measured in?
answers: Social metrics, such as followers and likes

question: What type of engagement marketing strategy involves reaching a target market with content that is so “awesome,” those who access it will tell all of their friends about it?
answers: Going viral

question: Which of the following statements is true of anonymous relationships with a target market?
answers: Companies can communicate with them using a social handle.

question: The social site Upworthy found that viral content occurs when you address three parameters. Which of the following is NOT one of those parameters?
answers: The content must blend in with other common marketing.

question: Nurture Marketing is designed to develop which of the following?
answers: A 1-to-1 sales relationship with social visitors.

question: Which of the following is true about Embrace Marketing? Check all that apply: (This question has more than one correct answer)
answers: Database-driven, long-term relationships are common with Embrace Marketing.
Embrace is an acronym that stands for Empowering Brand Activated Community Engagement.
The Nurture Marketing and Social IMC strategies are two types of Embrace Marketing.

question: Which of the following are the most important questions to ask in a Nurture Marketing strategy? Check all that apply. (This question has more than one correct answer)
answers: “Who are you?”
“Where are you in the product purchase lifecycle?”

question: After acquiring registration and email information from prospects, a company should NOT do which of the following?
answers: Send daily emails about their products and services in order to generate sales.

question: Which of the following is typically a feature of the landing page? Check all that apply. (This question has more than one correct answer)
answers: Social links to like or follow
High impact sales copy
Company logo and title
Knowledgebase data fields

question: Which of the following will help ensure future success when collecting knowledgebase data? Check all that apply. (This question has more than one correct answer)
answers: Companies should attach a tracking cookie to allow them to understand their market segment and current point in the product purchase lifecycle.
Companies should keep it short and simple. The more information they ask for, the more registrants they will lose.
Companies should send registrants a follow-up email invitation to access your relevant content, ensuring accuracy of their email address.

question: Which of the following statements best describes a filter and focus blog?
answers: The blog author(s) filters through all of the relevant content from the experts on a subject and narrows it down to the most timely, relevant, and credible information and recommendations.

question: Which of the following are important in creating effective, impactful blog posts? Check all that apply. (This question has more than one correct answer)
answers: Images
Catchy headlines
Clean formatting
Relevant topic

question: When formatting a blog article, which of the following is NOT recommended?
answers: Long paragraphs that explore topics in depth.

question: What information should be included in a successful filter and focus blog article? Check all that apply. (This question has more than one correct answer)
answers: Unbiased, summaries of information from the experts
Relevant and actionable recommendations
A way to contact you

question: What are the three main choices marketers have in spending their time and money?
answers: Paid, owned, and earned media

question: Marketing pundits and agencies mostly agree that marketers should “pay as little as you can, own as much as you can, and earn positive social mentions.” What unsolvable questions does this riddle still pose? Check all that apply.
answers: Who can simply rely on the behavior of others?
How much exactly is “pay a little”?
What if you build it and they don’t come?

question: Why has paid media become so expensive given all of the options available today? Shouldn’t paid media prices have declined?
answers: The supply of mass media has declined.

question: In IMC’s rethinking of traditional marketing approaches, which of the following would be the logical first step in the P/O/E media strategy?
answers: Find out who you are trying to reach.

question: Which type of advertising is intended to motivate an immediate action?
answers: Direct response advertising

question: Which type of advertising is intended to change awareness or perceptions in order to influence future behavior?
answers: Persuasion/Big Brand advertising

question: Which type of advertising is intended to gain notice from key people?
answers: Stunting/Visibility advertising

question: When using Facebook-style advertising, we’ve referred to “the Funnel.” At which stage in the funnel is it easiest to achieve your goal?
answers: The bottom of the funnel

question: In a response marketing process, what should marketers do after first identifying their specific goal?
answers: Throw everything against the wall and see what sticks.

question: Social IMC Strategy involves which of the following strategies?
answers: Social IMC is designed to embrace a high-value market you want to develop and take them to a private virtual community you develop specifically for them.

question: To be successful, a Social IMC strategy must contain which of the following? Check all that apply.
answers: Excellent, engaging content
An empowering concept that will transition a high-value market over to the private virtual community

question: What actions are necessary in developing an empowering concept? Check all that apply.
answers: Identify the mission of the community.
Create the tool, event, or device that will help the community.
Identify additional services that will keep the members coming back.

question: In the Social IMC strategy, what roles can products play in a private virtual community? Check all that apply.
answers: A product can be an enhancer for the community members.
A product can be an enabler for the community members.
A product can be an extra for the community members.

question: Which of the following are proven success tips when using Social IMC strategy? Check all that apply.
answers: Private virtual communities can be created by invitation.
Social IMC allows you to vet your incoming members.

question: Which of the following areas are effective targets for applying the Social IMC strategy? Check all that apply.
answers: Private, controlled discussion with community members
Audiences resistant to social marketing efforts
Highest-value markets

question: If your high-value market is easy to target as they move through a purchase lifecycle, which marketing strategy gives you trackability, lower cost, and sales focus?
answers: Nurture Marketing

question: For lower-value markets, which marketing strategy allows you to keep them interested and makes you a strong contender when they are ready to buy?
answers: Engagement Marketing

question: If you have a commodity product like soap, which marketing strategy would be the most effective?
answers: Engagement Marketing

question: Which of the following performance metrics are used in Engagement Marketing? Check all that apply.
answers: Growth in likes
Number of opens or views of content
Click-throughs to blogs and websites

question: Which of the following performance metrics can be used in Embrace Marketing? Check all that apply.
answers: Number of opens or views of content
Revenues, investments, and profits
Social break-even and ROI numbers
Growth in likes

question: What is the purpose of the performance funnel?
answers: The performance funnel is designed to track a relationship with a consumer from start to finish within a marketing channel.

question: In the performance funnel, you will notice that, with each successive step, consumers...
answers: decrease in number

question: The percentage or other measure that is calculated based on the fall-off between two successive steps in the performance funnel is known as...
answers: Key Performance Indicator

question: Why is testing the effectiveness of a marketing strategy important? Check all that apply.
answers: Testing is simple and easy.
Testing is low cost.
Testing is real and provides feedback coming directly from your target markets.

question: When is head-to-head testing used?
answers: When the business or marketer can control who is being contacted

question: When are A/B Split tests used?
answers: When the business or marketer has no control over who is being contacted

question: When considering data generated through our use of social sites, which of the following statements about “privacy” concerns is/are accurate? Check all that apply.
answers: Privacy involves concerns that the relationships we are developing on social are controlled by us and used in appropriately by community managers.
Privacy involves the concern of the individual that the information and behavioral data they have supplied is used appropriately by you.

question: In discussing security, privacy, and governance, Seth Redmore discussed “progressive profiling.” Which of the following statements is an attributes of “progressive profiling”?
answers: Progressive profiling involves an exchange of value between a company and consumer, such as name and email from the consumer resulting in a free white paper from the company.

question: Which of the following members of an organization are security professionals who already have an open dialogue with the Board or CEO on data security?
answers: Influencers

question: Which of the following would be included in a fully integrated marketing plan? Choose all that apply.
answers: Content syndication
Direct Response
Promotions
Social

question: When using metrics to measure success in social, which of the following would be most appropriate for measuring the success of the content syndication of a video? Choose one.
answers: Cost per complete view

question: What is a present-day framework that explains the current engagement ecosystem, including insight into how social engagement can play an active role?
answers: Customer Engagement Engine

question: The metric for Amplification measures what?
answers: A measure of viral reach or how much your content has inspired your social audience to share it

question: What are performance funnels?
answers: Performance funnels track the consumer journey from total market to product purchase.

question: In MOOC 2, we provided you with a number of social analytics tools. What did you learn about the importance of hashtags and keywords in building your professional persona?
answers: OOC 2, we provided you with a number of

From these experiences, let us know the following: 1. How many followers did you grow over the last few months on LinkedIn? 2. How many groups did you engage with on LinkedIn? 3. How many followers did you engage in Google +? 4. How many professional communities did you engage with on Google+? 5. What other social sites did you develop for your professional persona? 6. What other community sites did you develop for your professional persona?
answers: OOC 2, we provided you with a number of

question: Throughout the MOOCs, you were asked to tweet to both our Social Media Marketing twitter site, to me [@RandyHlavac] and to your professional target markets. 1. How many Twitter followers did you grow for your professional and social media marketing targets? 2. What did you enjoy or learn from your Tweeting experiences? 3. Will you continue them after MOOC 5 ends?
answers: OOC 2, we provided you with a number of

question: In MOOC 3 you developed a blog and in MOOC 4 tested and then rolled out your blog to your high value market. From these experiences, answer the following: 1. How many readers read your blog? 2. How many comments did you receive? 3. What did you learn from the A/B Message tests? 4. Overall, what did you learn or experience from the blogging assignments? 5. Are you planning to continue blogging after the MOOC specialization?
answers: OOC 2, we provided you with a number of

They were selected to give you experience with Social Big Data as well as a way to quickly define, understand and engage with your high value markets. Please answer the following: Which tools were the greatest value to you? Which tools were the hardest or least productive to use? Overall, what did you think of this hands-on approach to Social Big Data? Any recommendations for future development?
answers: OOC 2, we provided you with a number of

question: 1. Overall, what did you like best about the entire Specialization [up to the Capstone]? 2. Overall, what are areas we can improve or expand for future learners? 3. What are the actions or areas of activity you will continue after this MOOC ends? 4. OPTIONAL: As you know, multi-media – especially video – is an effective way to communicate with others. If you enjoyed the specialization, we would like to ask you for one more thing. Using your smart phone or computer, would you be willing to record a short video – NO MORE THAN 3 MINUTES – which covers the following: A. Your name and, if applicable, your company name B. The city and country where you reside C. 1 – 3 greatest learnings you had from the specialization Create the video and submit it to us at socialmkting.mooc@gmail.com. We want to hear from you to learn what you liked about the specialization and, if it is short enough, we would like to add it to our private YouTube site to let other learners who are considering the program learn about what you experienced.

question: Which of the following steps are involved in developing your budget? Choose all that apply.
answers: Determine your marketing channels and costs.
Develop your staffing costs.
Create performance funnels and establish Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
Determine your technology costs.

question: What indicates success has been achieved when calculating the marketing return on investment (MROI) of a program?
answers: The MROI is over 100%

question: What are the benefits of a pilot program for a social marketing strategy? Choose all that apply.
answers: Pilots help identify the risks of the program.
It’s a way to convince skeptical senior management to at least try the program to see its benefits.
Pilots help to position your company’s community contribution in the minds of your high value market.
A pilot program allows you to gauge action performance and make adjustments to the program before you commit to a plan.

question: Which of the following methods assist is developing a pilot project? Choose all that apply.
answers: Reduce the breadth or reach of the program.
Reduce the timing of the program.
Reduce the scope of the original plan.

question: Testing different types of media to determine the ones which reach your target markets in an efficient and effective way is known as ______?
answers: Maximizing market share

question: Which of the following tips should you follow to keep your communities alive and growing on social? Choose all that apply.
answers: Monitor influencer reactions and community feedback.
Constantly develop and deploy new content.
Keep testing performance funnels
Monitor your Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) every day.
Involve your influencers and community members

question: When is it important to use a "for fee" social analytics system?
answers: When you need to analyze a topic over a period of time

question: Sentiment accuracy is difficult to ascertain on which level?
answers: Document
